decision_conditions: Condition : 5 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 6 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match the original facing materials of the existing buildings in type, colour, dimensions and in the case of brickwork, bond, coursing and pointing.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development Order 1995 (or any other Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings shall be formed in the north west elevation of the building without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To protect the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 8 - Before the building/extension hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the north east elevation (at first floor level) shall be glazed with obscure glass and shall be permanently maintained as such thereafter.  Reason for condition: To protect the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.
description: ERECTION OF A FIRST FLOOR REAR EXTENSION
